page.title: 12MOXON'S MILL
page.content: The factory was built and opened in 1950 by the family B.H Moxon and Son Ltd. Moxon's Mill is part of the Allied Textile Companies plc group. Moxon's Mill was a family group until Matthew Moxon retired then the Tulketh Group bought the firm. It was then bought by ATC in 1971. Where the mill was built was known as Southfields _ thats where the mill got it's name from.90% of the cloth is sent to Japan and also Hong Kong, Singapore, U.S.A. Canada, Italy and other European countries .The mill only uses the finest quality wool and other luxury fibres such as cashmere and cloth woven with gold thread.The business was founded at the old Providence Mills.Two years later they moved to Springfield Mills Ltd.The ATC is a company joined together and it employs 100 people.
